<QuestionSource url="https://www.boxofficemojo.com/year/world/2026/">
## Summary: 2026 Worldwide Box Office (Box Office Mojo)

**Note:** The article appears to be a snapshot of the Box Office Mojo 2026 worldwide box office rankings page, likely captured at a point early in 2026. The data is truncated after rank ~197, and no film has come close to the $1 billion threshold.

### Key Facts:

- **No film has reached $1 billion** in worldwide gross as of the data captured in this article.
- The **top-grossing film of 2026** so far is **Wuthering Heights** at **$152,112,788** worldwide — far below the $1 billion threshold.
- The **second-highest grossing film** is **GOAT** at **$102,156,788** worldwide.
- The **third-highest** is **Send Help** at **$82,950,948** worldwide.
- Films ranked 4th through 10th range from approximately **$41M to $58M** worldwide.
- The vast majority of listed films earned well under $50 million, with many earning under $1 million.
- Several films are domestic-only or foreign-only releases with modest totals.
- Re-releases (e.g., Lord of the Rings trilogy) appear in the rankings but with modest figures (under $9M each).

### Bottom Line:
As of this data snapshot, the highest-grossing 2026 film worldwide has earned approximately **$152 million** — roughly **15% of the $1 billion resolution threshold**.
</QuestionSource>

<QuestionSource url="https://screenrant.com/super-mario-galaxy-movie-box-office-billion-original-prediction/">
## Summary: *The Super Mario Galaxy Movie* Box Office Outlook (Screen Rant, Jan. 31, 2026)

### Key Facts
- **The Super Mario Bros. Movie (2023)** earned **$1.36 billion** worldwide, the second-highest-grossing film of 2023 behind *Barbie*
- **The Super Mario Galaxy Movie** is scheduled to release on **April 1, 2026**
- A second trailer was released on **January 26, 2026**, focusing heavily on the addition of **Yoshi** and multi-world exploration

### Author's Revised Assessment
- The author (a Screen Rant writer, not an independent analyst) initially expected the sequel to be a big hit but fall **short of $1 billion**, citing:
  - Difficulty reaching the $1B benchmark generally
  - Absence of the pent-up excitement that drove the original's performance
  - The original's mixed critical reception (59% critics / 95% audience on Rotten Tomatoes)
- After viewing the **second trailer**, the author reversed their position, now predicting the sequel will **surpass the original's $1.36B** and potentially be the **highest-grossing film of 2026**
- Key reasons for the revised outlook: the sequel appears more ambitious in scope, deeper in game references, and capable of recapturing viewers who were lukewarm on the original
- The film is also noted to have a **favorable release window**, launching ahead of summer blockbusters with limited competition for several weeks
</QuestionSource>
